result.execSummary:
The defendant Harvey E. Nigh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Costs have been paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:10 p.m. Defendant Harvey E. Nigh in court with attorney Jerod Barkley.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has complied with all of the terms of the Deferred Sentencing Agreement. Defendant being sentenced as to Count 1 only. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP and DNA surcharge.
Sentencing hearing at 02-23-2016 01:00 pm

11:20 am case called. Defendant Harvey E. Nigh in court with attorney Jerod Barkley.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached. State moves to amend count 1 to remove the dangerous weapon enhancer.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Count 1 as amended-No Contest. Count 2-No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright the Dangerous weapon enhancer. Count 1-6 month deferred sentencing. Count 2-Court sentences the defendant to costs, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-18-2015 11:15 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jerod Barkley in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Barkley:  Believes that matter will be resolved - requests add'l time to work out terms.   P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Status conference at 07-07-2015 09:45 am

Case Called @ 11:32 AM: Defendant Harvey E. Nigh in court with attorney Jerod Barkley.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per DA:  Counsel still exploring resolution and fact pattern.  Atty Barkley agrees with DA's recital.  STC rescheduled.  Court undertakes Bail/Bond Review.  Argument by Atty Barkley as to bond modification as to bar prohibition.  Statement by Def as to recent missed events due to prohibition.  Future events scheduled that may preclude his attendance.  Argument by DA as to bond review.  Further argument by Atty Barkley.  Court explains details of standard condition of bond as to prohibition in bars - not restaurants - must avoid bar area.  Violation of the order comes into play if Def is in the bar area.  Atty Barkley and Def understand distinction - bond will not need to be amended.  Def is allowed to attend future functions as long as he remains outside the bar area.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Status conference at 06-11-2015 11:15 am (Rescheduled at request of Attorney Berkley)
Status conference at 06-23-2015 10:00 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jerod Barkley in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Barkley requesting another STC. Atty Barkley filed a motion to modify bond. The court will address the modification of bond at a later date.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Amended Motion for Modification of Bond
for Modification of Bond - the Court will address at the next hearing
Status conference at 05-26-2015 09:35 am

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:07 PM: Defendant Harvey E. Nigh in court with attorney Jerod Barkley.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered as to both charges in the Complaint.   DA argues for $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection to bond request by Defense.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:35 am.
